netapp_snapshot_policies_create_informat: To create your scheduling rules, you need to specify a prefix and a duration in minutes. You can optionally enter the hours, days and months of execution to refine your scheduling. You can add multiple values by separating them with a comma. By default, an empty field will take all of the available values.
netapp_snapshot_policies_create_exemple_: Take a snapshot at 06:00, noon, 18:00, midnight and keep the latest four copies.
Take a snapshot on days 1, 2 and 5 of the months of February, April, June, August, October and December for the 5<sup>th</sup> and 10<sup>th</sup> minutes of 03:00 and 10:00.
netapp_snapshot_policies_create_days_hel: Specifies the days on which the snapshot schedule will run. This property is a list of values. The minimum value for this property is {{min}}, and the maximum value is {{max}}.
netapp_snapshot_policies_create_minutes_: Specifies the minutes that the snapshot schedule will run. This property is a list of values. The minimum value for this property is {{min}}, and the maximum value is {{max}}.
netapp_snapshot_policies_create_hours_he: Specifies the hours that the snapshot schedule will run. This property is a list of values. The minimum value for this property is {{min}}, and the maximum value is {{max}}.
netapp_snapshot_policies_create_months_h: Specifies the months that the snapshot schedule will run. This property is a list of values. The minimum value for this property is {{min}}, and the maximum value is {{max}}.
netapp_snapshot_policies_create_weekdays: Specifies the days of the week that the snapshot schedule will run. This property is a list of values. The minimum value for this property is {{min}}, and the maximum value is {{max}}.
netapp_snapshot_policies_create_error: An error has occurred creating the snapshot policy.
netapp_snapshot_policies_create_success: The {{snapshotPolicyName}} snapshot policy has been created.
